text: Sixto Alfonso Durán-Ballén Cordovez (July 14, 1921 - November 15, 2016) was an American-born Ecuadorian political figure and architect. He served as Mayor of Quito between 1970 and 1978, and as President of Ecuador between 1992 and 1996. He served as congressman in 1984 and again in 1998. ==Early life== Ballén was born Sixto Alfonso Durán-Ballén Cordovez on July 14, 1921 in Boston, Massachusetts.Sixto Duran Ballen at hipecuador.htm He married Josefina Villalobos in 1948. ==Career== He was elected mayor of Quito in 1970 and re-elected in 1974. In 1979 he ran as the PSC's presidential candidate, but was defeated by the populist Jaime Roldós Aguilera. In 1988 he ran again, but was eliminated in the first round. After León Febres Cordero's faction inside the PSC succeeded in appointing Jaime Nebot as the party's presidential candidate in 1992, Durán Ballén and his supporters left the party to form the more right-wing Republican Union Party. Eventually, Durán defeated Nebot in the second round of the presidential election. ==Personal life== Ballén has two children. He was married to Josefina Villalobos. He lived in Quito. He was the oldest living former Ecuadorian president. Ballén died on the night of November 15, 2016 at his home in Quito, aged 95. ==References== ==Other websites== * Official Website of the Ecuadorian Government about the country President's History Category:1921 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Ecuadorian architects Category:Mayors of Quito Category:Presidents of Ecuador Category:Politicians from Boston
